article.headline: DePaul 75, UAB 64
article.story: ROSEMONT, Ill. (AP) -- Quemont Greer had 18 points and eight rebounds and Sammy Mejia added 16 points to lead DePaul to 75-64 win over Alabama-Birmingham on Saturday. DePaul (9-6, 2-2 Conference USA) took a 45-30 on a 3-pointer by Greer early in the second half, its largest lead of the game. Alabama-Birmingham (9-5, 2-1) went on a 20-5 run to get back into the game. Derrick Broom and Mo Finley each hit 3s to open the spurt that cut the DePaul lead to 59-57. Broom had eight points during the span. But Drake Diener responded for DePaul. He keyed an 8-1 DePaul run, hitting a 3-pointer and a jumper to give DePaul a 67-58 lead with 3:18 left. Diener scored 14 points for DePaul. Gabe Kennedy led Alabama-Birmingham with 17 points and 12 rebounds and Donell Taylor added 10 points. Alabama-Birmingham had won the last four meetings between the two teams. DePaul led 37-24 at the half. Greer and Mejia both had seven points to lead DePaul at half. Mejia hit a jumper to give DePaul a 28-13 lead with 8:01 left in the half. Alabama-Birmingham held Delonte Holland to just 10 points. Holland came into the game averaging 20 points per game. Andre Brown missed his seventh straight game with knee discomfort. He is DePaul's leading rebounder.
